Anthony "Tony" Vivaldi is the overarching antagonist of the 1993 action-comedy film Last Action Hero and the main antagonist of the in-universe movie Jack Slater IV.

He was portrayed by the late Anthony Quinn.

Biography[]

In the film, Vivaldi was the main antagonist of the Jack Slater movie "Jack Slater IV." He was the richest and most powerful Sicilian mafia boss in LA. His henchman, the main antagonist of the film, Mr. Benedict hates him and kills him, and he finally takes over his entire villa, and going out to kill Jack Slater and Danny. He is also responsible to the death of Slater's cousin Frank. In the police of LA, John Practice helps Benedict but gets killed by Slater after Danny's arrival to the movie. Around the end of the movie, Benedict came to his (Vivaldi's) swimming pool and pulled out his gun, shooting Vivaldi who died, and took over his house.

Personality[]

Being in a typical action flick, Vivaldi is your average Saturday morning cartoonish villain: Greedy, diabolical, cruel, but has a slightly comical side. He is also shown to act pretty impatient at times and be somewhat playful, in his own horrible ways of course, such as joking about getting Slater's cousin cooked.

Trivia[]

He has the habit of messing up maxims (e.g. "You've gone 360 on me," instead of 180), which is to the great chagrin of Mr. Benedict, who corrects him under his breath.
